p: An important feature also highlighted in Hirsch et al. [ 15] is the fact that the total effect of irrigation or albedo on the regional temperatures is found to be almost independent of the level of global warming (close to constant offset from the line for the CTL experiment; figure 9). This means that, in relative terms, the changes in land-based conditions play a much more important role for low-emissions rather than high-emissions scenarios. For this reason, considering such feedbacks in the development of ambitious mitigation scenarios is essential.
